intro: Hieracioides bursifolia, commonly known as the burrleaf hieracioides, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves that are often lobed or toothed, with the lower leaves sometimes bearing small, bur-like structures. It typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown, and it produces small, dry fruits that aid in seed dispersal.
